ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: supply and demand in firm and market level
I learned the basics of consumer theory and firm theory, the math behind each, and applications.
A general knowledge of the economy

I learned how to look at the world in economic terms and apply economic principles to things not involving money in my everyday life. I learned that almost every interaction/decision can be an economic one.
I was able to grasp basic economic principles.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: sometimes Tolga goes off a tangent and talks about random stuff for way too long. This means his class is really interesting because Tolga have really interesting life stories that is definitely worth hearing. But this also means that when you are sleep-deprived and just want to get your work done, you realized how much shorter the class could have been to cover the same material. Also, 80% of your grade in this class is based on 2 tests only and is curved with only 50 other people, so the curve is really variable, and if there happen to be a few smart classmates, then your grade might not be good. There could be more psets for practice too.

Strengths: each class was very informative, taught in a fun way, and made easy to understand; Tolga was incredibly helpful; tutor hours were also helpful
Weaknesses: exams sometimes included things that weren't discussed in class (but if you read the textbook, you'd find them)
Great lectures, not enough problem sets to enforce the information
More pratical applications would be nice.

strengths: tolga. hes a very good instructor. seminar format allows for questions and discussion. we come up with our own examples. 

weaknesses: lack of problem sets/curve
I found it very difficult to follow along in class. I felt it was assumed I would know everything already.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes. econ could be an important concept to learn. you know more about how individual consumers and firms make decisions and implicit biases and stuff that may somewhat be applicable in real life
Yes! Tolga is an excellent professor and really nice guy, and he'll give you a good introduction to and grasp of microeconomics.
Yes, if you're looking for a broad course about economics (but only with Tolga Koker)
yes, you will learn how to see the world in a different lens and how to understand other individuals decision making
Yes, helping to understand how thighs work in life etc.
